frame.name: Funding
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Supplier</fen> gives funds to a <fen>Recipient</fen> to fulfill a need or purpose (<fen>Imposed_purpose</fen>) of the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Sup">The University</fex> <t>funded</t> <fex name="Rec">Paige</fex> <fex name="Imp">so that she could complete her doctorate</fex>.</ex> <ex></ex>
Often, the <fen>Imposed_purpose</fen> appears as a direct object of the target verb instead of the <fen>Recipient</fen>. With these, the <fen>Imposed_purpose</fen> can either be metonymically linked to some <fen>Recipient</fen>, in which case the <fen>Recipient</fen> FE is marked as DNI: <ex><fex name="Sup">Investors</fex> <t>financed</t> <fex name="Imp">the software start-up</fex>.<fex name="Rec">DNI</fex></ex>
or it can explicitly encompass the <fen>Recipient</fen>, in which case the <fen>Recipient</fen> part is annotated on a second FE layer: <ex><fex name="Sup">Lobbyists</fex> <t>backed</t> <fex name="Imp">the senator's campaign for president</fex>.</ex> . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . <fex name="Rec">the senator's</fex></def-root>

FE.name: Supplier
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Supplier</fen> is the person or entity that funds the <fen>Recipient</fen> or <fen>Imposed_purpose</fen>. <ex><fex name="Sup">Investors</fex> <t>bankrolled</t> the software start-up early on.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Recipient
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Recipient</fen> is the person, people, or organization funded by the <fen>Supplier</fen>.
<ex>Some governments <t>fund</t> <fex name="Rec">students</fex> so that they can obtain doctorates and enter public service.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Imposed_purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Imposed_purpose</fen> is the intended purpose of the funding.
<ex>The board agreed to <t>finance</t> <fex name="Imp">the research program</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> are the conditions under which the funding is supplied.
<ex>Hank's parents continued to <t>support</t> him <fex name="Cir">as long as he was actively looking for a job</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE is the <fen>Explanation</fen> for which the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives funding to the <fen>Recipient</fen> or <fen>Imposed_purpose</fen>.
<ex>Western governments <t>financed</t> the undertaking <fex name="Exp">because they desired access to new oil reserves</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the funding event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Supplier</fen> that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
<ex>Paul <fex name="Man">unwittingly</fex> <t>funded</t> his brother's drinking habit.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE expresses the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Supplier</fen> funds the <fen>Recipient</fen> or <fen>Imposed_purpose</fen>.
<ex>Marie <t>funded</t> her trip to Mexico <fex name="Mns">by tutoring kids throughout the summer</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Period_of_iterations
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE designates the period over which the <fen>Supplier</fen> engages in (multiple) funding acts.
<ex>Our company has <t>backed</t> the governor's election campaigns <fex name="Per">since 2000</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Supplier</fen> funds the <fen>Recipient</fen> or <fen>Imposed_purpose</fen>.
<ex>The Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation <t>funded</t> public libraries <fex name="Pla">in rural Kenya</fex>, providing them with free Internet access.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> of the funding.
<ex>Hank's parents <t>supported</t> him by drawing <fex name="Sou">from their retirement fund</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives funds to the <fen>Recipient</fen> or <fen>Imposed_purpose</fen>.
<ex>The project was officially <t>funded</t> <fex name="Tim">at noon today</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Money
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Money</fen> is the specified currency or amount of funding.
<ex>Band manager Mohammed has <t>financed</t> their project <fex name="Mon">to the tune of $5,000</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Supplier</fen> funds the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
<ex>Banks <t>financed</t> the undertaking <fex name="Purp">so that Western nations would have access to new oil reserves</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: fund.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to provide funds for (a program, project, etc.)

lexUnit.name: finance.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to supply with money, capital, or credit

lexUnit.name: back.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to support or help by giving money

lexUnit.name: bankroll.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to finance; provide funds for
